Package scenes

Class Scene

  • java.lang.Object
    • processing.core.PApplet
      • scenes.Scene
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    processing.core.PConstants
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    BattleField, Camp, Death, Instructions, Pause, TitleScreen
    public abstract class Scene
extends processing.core.PApplet
    A common superclass for everything PApplet that stores all of the objects in the screen. It also handles side scrolling and keeps track of the main hero.
    Version:
    5/21/18
    Author:
    Ben

    • Constructor Detail

      • Scene

        public Scene​(Main m,
             Hero focusedSprite,
             java.awt.geom.Rectangle2D.Double worldSpace,
             int xPadding,
             int yPadding,
             int renderDistance)
        This creates a new scene. If you don't want it to side scroll, just set the world space to the the assumed drawing width and height
        Parameters:
        m - - the main method
        focusedSprite - - the sprite to follow with the camera. If this scene doesn't scroll just put any Sprite that is on the window.
        worldSpace - - the size of the level
        xPadding - - the distance from each side on the x axis that the focused sprite can not reach
        yPadding - - the distance from each side on the y axis that the focused sprite can not reach
        renderDistance - - the distance off the screen that is drawn

      • Scene

        public Scene​(Main m,
             Hero joe)
        This creates a new scene. If you don't want it to side scroll, just set the world space to the the assumed drawing width and height If using this constructor, setup(Sprite) must be called.
        Parameters:
        m - - the main method
        worldSpace - - the size of the level
        xPadding - - the distance from each side on the x axis that the focused sprite can not reach
        yPadding - - the distance from each side on the y axis that the focused sprite can not reach
        renderDistance - - the distance off the screen that is drawn
